section: II - In-house lobbyists and trade/business/professional associations
goals__remit:
The Entrepreneurs Association of Slovakia (official abbreviation “EAS”), as the first organisation of private entrepreneurs established after the “Velvet revolution” in November 1989, is a decisive representative of private business sector. This sector did not exist in Slovakia before 1989. 
The Entrepreneur Association of Slovakia has been formed in December 1989. It is the founding member of an umbrella organization of employers, The National Union of Employers. 
The EAS mainly focuses on the crucial issues of creating and guaranteeing the favourable business environment with simple legislative framework and low administrative and financial burden.  
The Entrepreneur Association of Slovakia is a non-profit organization. It is financed exclusively by voluntary contributions of its members and by local and foreign corporate donations and individual contributions.
relevant_communication:
1. Longtime pressure to improve administrative and expert capacities for better law making resulting into a creation of "Better Regulation center" at the Slovak Business Agency where The EAS is a founding member 
 
2. Bureaucratic Nonsense of the Year - a Golden Raspberry type of !award" for the worst administrative measure representing unnecessary and sometimes irrational burden 
 
3. Various awards for young and innovative entrepreneurs
